recentFiles.basename: The mystery of human existence lies not in just staying alive, but in finding something to live for

recentFiles.basename: If we do keep improving our technology with enough care, foresight and planning to avoid pitfalls, life has the potential to flourish on Earth and far beyond for many billions of years, beyond the wildest dreams of our ancestors
recentFiles.path: If we do keep improving our technology with enough care, foresight and planning to avoid pitfalls, life has the potential to flourish on Earth and far beyond for many billions of years, beyond the wildest dreams of our ancestors.md

recentFiles.basename: If we don't improve our technology, the question isn't whether humanity will go extinct, but merely how — will an asteroid, a super volcano, the burning heat of the aging sun or some other calamity get us first
recentFiles.path: If we don't improve our technology, the question isn't whether humanity will go extinct, but merely how — will an asteroid, a super volcano, the burning heat of the aging sun or some other calamity get us first.md

recentFiles.basename: Once future life has bumped up against the physical limits on what it can do with its matter, there is only one way left for it to do more—by getting more matter.  And the only way it can do this is by expanding into our Universe
recentFiles.path: Once future life has bumped up against the physical limits on what it can do with its matter, there is only one way left for it to do more—by getting more matter.  And the only way it can do this is by expanding into our Universe.md
